::DeathScythe::

DeathScythe opens one eye as he hears Zyber come in, watching her as 
she checks up at him. He felt much better. His sides and chest no 
longer ached, and he no longer felt lightheaded or tired.

DeathScythe gets to his feet, muttering "DeathScythe, assassinate," 
and transforming into robot mode. He looks down at himself, looking 
over his hideous form.

His wolf hind-legs served as his feet, an extra pair of arms coming 
out to serve as his robot arms, leaving two hooves sticking out 
behind his back. Out of his shoulder stuck several fish fins, the 
other one carrying the shark fin. His whole body was covered by 
random patches of different skins, hides, fur, and scales. Out of his 
back stuck his beast mode head, grinning its collection of teeth. His 
wings were folded over his back, providing a cape to hide his beast 
mode head, making it look like a hump on his back.

He walks out of the bedchamber, looking around for Zyber. He had to 
get some information out of her, about this planet among other 
things, and then she would no longer be neccessary.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> * Zyber looked through the blinding snow, but saw nor smelled any 
game.
> But then she remembered jusy why she had journeyed all the way to 
the 
> south...to find game in the first place.
> She looked left and then right, still seeing nothing other then 
pure snow.
> A sigh escaped her muzzle. This was turning out to be a tougher day 
then she 
> expected.
> However, she couldn't just leave that bot in her cave either, slag 
knew that 
> he could get a cold or even worse without being under her watchful 
eye.
> Zyber turned back towards her den with a heavy step, feeling every 
one of 
> her muscles complain and protest as she moved.
> 
> By the time she reached her den the storm had nearly died down, 
entering 
> into the warmth and safety of her home...covered in snow.
> Walking into the shadows she came to the enterence of her bed 
chamber, 
> looking in to see just how Blaster(DeathSkythe) was.
> 
> Seeing that everything was alright she moved on to the main 
chamber, where 
> tones of quartze crystls hun from the cieling and sprouted up from 
the 
> floor.
> There was already a warm fire burning over to the right of the 
room, and the 
> plunked herself down near it and shook herself. Spatters of snow 
hitting the 
> flames and hissing as they mented.*
> 
>
